ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes - if that student was part of the Clinical Psychology Graduate program, this is a required course.
This class was well-designed to meet the APA requirement and I could recommend it to others.
This course is useful, especially for those of us who didn't major in psychology in college.

I would recommend this course to a junior graduate student as it provides a good basis from which to move forward with your clinical research and training. It was interesting to learn about the historical perspective of our field and how trends in research and practice have influenced one another.
This is a course each student must take! More than worth it!
Broad survey of the history of psychology from a sub-field of ancient philosophy to its present clinical practice. Generally a good course, would recommend it.
Good overview over the field of psychology. I would recommend taking this course.

A thorough review of major historical developments in the field of clinical psychology. I would recommend this class to another student because it gave a historical perspective, which is not typical of most psych courses.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Helped fulfill requirements and gave a great overview of the history of our field.
It is important to know about the history of the field and get a better sense of how my research and the research I follow today fits in the development of the field.

I am not sure how this course directly impacted my research, yet the course set the stage for my future clinical work and introduced modern and past practices of clinical training. It was interesting to learn about current practices in the field from a more historical perspective.
This deepened my knowledge by helping me see a broader context for my research and studies.

This course helped me to connect aspects of the history of psychology that I hadn't previously understood, and in particular to see how those movements connected with larger philosophical and cultural trends that I was more familiar with. In that way it helped to broaden my own base of knowledge and complemented my research interests in other fields.
Helped to enhance my background, historical knowledge of the field.
